channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live updates: Thousands flee homes in Lebanon as toll from Israeli strikes rises to 564, officials say
item.dc:creator: Suzan Haidamous, Leo Sands, Kelly Kasulis Cho, Adela Suliman, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: Israel urged civilians to evacuate parts of eastern Lebanon linked to Hezbollah. Monday was the deadliest single day of conflict in Lebanon since its 15-year civil war.

item.title: IDF says it hit 1,500 more Hezbollah targets in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Kelly Kasulis Cho, Lior Soroka, Leo Sands, Bryan Pietsch

item.title: Thousands flee to safer areas in Lebanon; flights canceled
item.dc:creator: Suzy Haidamous, Leo Sands, Bryan Pietsch

item.dc:creator: Jackson Barton, Kelsey Baker

item.title: Judge rejects Heritage Foundation bid to release Prince Harry visa records
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit
item.description: The conservative think tank argued the public had an interest in how the Department of Homeland Security handled Harry’s application given his past drug use.

item.title: Where Israel has struck in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Álvaro Valiño

item.title: As Israel turns to Lebanon, Gazans get reprieve but plead for help
item.dc:creator: Hazem Balousha, Adela Suliman
item.description: Gazan officials reported fewer strikes since Israel stepped up bombardments across Lebanon. Displaced Gazans sympathized with Lebanon but feared being sidelined.

item.title: Israel vows to return people north. Many residents see war as only way.
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Heidi Levine

item.title: Strikes have slowed in Gaza as Israel turns to Lebanon, official says
item.dc:creator: Hazem Balousha

item.title: Australia’s two largest supermarket chains sued over fake-discount claims
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Frances Vinall
item.description: The country’s regulator found that Woolworths and Coles hiked the price of Oreos, Kleenex and other staples before cutting them to create “illusory” discounts.

item.title: China moves to boost ailing economy with property, stimulus measures
item.dc:creator: Christian Shepherd, Anna Fifield
item.description: The world’s second-largest economy has struggled to rebound from the pandemic, leading financial authorities to cut interest rates and support the property market.

item.description: The discussion over weapons restrictions is ongoing in Washington, splitting the Biden administration and Capitol Hill and confounding America’s partners in Europe,

item.dc:creator: Suzan Haidamous, Susannah George, Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa, Rachel Chason

item.title: Afghan women have less freedom than cats, Meryl Streep says at U.N.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong
item.description: The actress said a cat that can “feel the sun on her face” and run through a park has more rights than Afghan girls and women under stricter Taliban laws.

item.title: Israel vows to return people north. Many residents see war as only way.
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Heidi Levine
item.description: Israelis who were evacuated from communities on the border with Lebanon — and some who defied orders and stayed — say they back another war with Hezbollah.

item.title: Israel launches ‘extensive’ strikes on Hezbollah; Lebanon says hundreds killed, more than 1,600 injured
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Niha Masih, Leo Sands, Jennifer Hassan, Susannah George, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Israel called for civilians in Lebanon to evacuate or move away from places it says could be storing weapons for Hezbollah.

item.title: López Obrador changed Mexico — but not in the ways he promised
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan, David Agren
item.description: The president’s support for the working poor was wildly popular. But he left much of his predecessors’ policies in place, and corruption, violence and impunity remain rampant.

item.title: Arab leaders condemn Israeli escalation in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Baker

item.title: What to know about Hezbollah, the group targeted by Israel in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Anika Seth, Adam Taylor, Victoria Bisset, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Hezbollah is one of the most powerful militant groups in the Middle East, a major political and social force in Lebanon, and a decades-long opponent of Israel.

item.title: Hundreds of Israeli airstrikes pound Lebanon, killing 492
item.dc:creator: Suzan Haidamous, Susannah George, Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa, Rachel Chason

item.title: Hundreds of Israeli airstrikes pound Lebanon as hostilities escalate
item.dc:creator: Suzan Haidamous, Susannah George, Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa, Rachel Chason
item.description: At least 492 people were killed Monday, Lebanese officials say, marking the deadliest day since Hezbollah and Israel intensified their conflict nearly a year ago.

item.title: Scholz dodges disaster with narrow SPD win over far right in German state
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady
item.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s SPD narrowly beat the far-right Alternative for Germany in the Brandenburg election, seen as a referendum on his leadership.

item.description: The apparent launch failure raised questions about Russia’s military capabilities and put in a dent in the Kremlin’s nuclear saber-rattling.

item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Ongoing crises in Sudan, Gaza and Ukraine have underscored the inefficacy of the world’s foremost decision-making body. Great power competition may be to blame.

item.title: Hezbollah enters ‘new phase’ against Israel; Netanyahu vows to do ‘whatever it takes’ in fight
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Rachel Pannett, Leo Sands, Annabelle Timsit, Maham Javaid, Kelsey Baker
item.description: Hezbollah says it will fight until there is a cease-fire in Gaza. Israel struck Hezbollah targets in Lebanon after Hezbollah launched missiles at the Ramat David air base.
